model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Speaker B, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Speaker A: Do you use technology like text messaging to interact with your grandkids?
Speaker B: No I can't get my head round it, I much rather a good ol fashioned phone call!
Speaker A: I have had to learn just to keep in touch with my family because of my hours at my job. It is not easy, I understand.
Speaker B: Well thankfully I don't have that problem these days, I get to spend some great time with my grandkids. Have you thought any more about the idea of our annual fishing trip? 
Speaker A: Yes, I think you should start planning this with your family and try and do different locations every year so that it changes up the scenery
Speaker B: Yes I think that's a great idea, how is work at the library? 
Speaker A: Busy, and demanding because we are short staffed. While there seems to be little need for a library these days, I find that we have less staff to get everything done
Speaker B: Well if you ever need someone to come and help for a couple of hours here and there, give me a call, you know how much I love to be in the library anyway
Speaker A: I will keep that in mind as we do have volunteer hours available. How is your family doing these days?

[MEMORY]
Speaker A used to be a librarian and loves kids, mentioning having 3 children. This is similar to Speaker B mentioning having grandkids, implying they are older and have a family of their own. Speaker B also has grandkids and enjoys spending time with them at the park, which is why they took their grandkids fishing once, with mixed reactions from the kids.

Speaker B's mother was also a librarian like Speaker A, which causes Speaker A to be a retired librarian who enjoys implementing creative activities in their library.

Speaker B has a lot of kids, all grown up now and with kids of their own. This causes Speaker A to have kids and be busy with work, unable to spend as much time with them as they would like. Speaker B wants to spend time with their grandkids in the park, while Speaker A has children and grandchildren, with at least one child interested in learning the flute.

raw_prediction: My family is doing well, thank you for asking. How are your kids and grandkids holding up with everything going on?
prediction:
Brief explanation: The memory is useful in the context of the ongoing dialogue because it provides additional background on both Speaker A and Speaker B, which could be useful for expanding the discussion about families. This includes Speaker A's former role as a librarian and interest in planning creative activities in their library, which directly aligns with Speaker B's offer to volunteer assisting at the library. Similarly, the memory also mentions that Speaker B enjoys spending time with the grandkids at the park, which may directly link to their proposal of organizing annual fishing trips.
Judgement: Yes
